titleStmt.title: To BENJAMIN B. FRENCH,Benjamin Brown French (1800-70). Entered the Clerk’s Department of the American House of Representatives, 1833, and became Clerk in 1845. Later Commissioner of Public Buildings and worked on the Capitol building. Met CD at the House of Representatives, 10 Mar 42, and attended a dinner for CD on 14 March (Witness to the Young Republic: A Yankee’s Journal, 1828-1870, ed. Donald B. Cole & John J. McDonough, Hanover, New Hampshire, 1989, pp. 138-9; see also Pilgrim Letters 3, p. 132, n. 1). [24 MARCH 1842]
